com.brianmearns.crafter

Class ValueBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brianmearns.crafter.ValueBuilder<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<T>, com.google.common.base.Supplier<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ValueBuilder.DefaultValueBuilder, ValueBuilder.NeverValueBuilder

    public abstract class ValueBuilder<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Builder<T>
    A simple Builder for a single value. This is generally used as a utility inside another builder.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  ValueBuilder.DefaultValueBuilder<T> 
      protected static class  ValueBuilder.NeverValueBuilder<T>
      A ValueBuilder which doesn't actually do anything.
      protected static class  ValueBuilder.ValueBuilderOfBuilderFunction<T>
      A function that maps any builder of a value to a ValueBuilder of that builder.
      protected static class  ValueBuilder.ValueBuilderOfInstanceFunction<T>
      A function that maps any value to a ValueBuilder of that instance.

    • Method Detail

      • ofInstance

        @NotNull
@Contract(value="_ -> !null")
public static <T> ValueBuilder<T> ofInstance(T value)
        Instantiate a new ValueBuilder initialized with the given value. I.e., when the get() method is invoked, it will return value as the built object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type which is built by the returned builder.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to which the returned builder is initialized.

      • ofBuilder

        @NotNull
@Contract(value="_ -> !null")
public static <T> ValueBuilder<T> ofBuilder(Builder<T> value)
        Instantiate a new ValueBuilder initialized with the given value. I.e., when the get() method is invoked, it will delegate to the given object.

      • ofBuilderFunction

        @NotNull
@Contract(value=" -> !null")
public static <T> com.google.common.base.Function<Builder<T>,ValueBuilder<T>> ofBuilderFunction()
        Returns a function which maps Builders of objects to ValueBuilders, using the ofBuilder(Builder) method.

      • ofInstanceFunction

        @NotNull
@Contract(value=" -> !null")
public static <T> com.google.common.base.Function<T,ValueBuilder<T>> ofInstanceFunction()
        Returns a function which maps values to ValueBuilders of that value, using the ofInstance(Object) method.

      • set

        @NotNull
@Contract(value="_ -> !null")
public ValueBuilder<T> set(@Nullable
                                   T value)
        Sets the builder to use the given instance. The get() method will return this instance as is.
        Returns:
        This ValueBuilder itself, for chaining convenience.

      • set

        @NotNull
public ValueBuilder<T> set(@NotNull
                          Builder<T> valueBuilder)
        Use the given builder to get the value of the instance. The builder is not invoked to build the value immediately, it will be invoked when this builder's get() method is invoked.
        Returns:
        This ValueBuilder itself, for chaining convenience.

      • set

        @NotNull
protected abstract ValueBuilder<T> set(@NotNull
                          com.google.common.base.Supplier<T> value)
        Helper method to set the value that will be used by get() to return a new instance. This is a helper method which set(Builder) and set(Object) delegate to. The public interface does not allow generic Supplier objects to be used to set the value.
        Returns:
        This ValueBuilder itself, for chaining convenience.

      • apply

        @NotNull
protected abstract ValueBuilder<T> apply(@NotNull
                            com.google.common.base.Function<ValueBuilder<T>,java.lang.Void> function)
        Apply the given function to this object, and return this object again.

        This is simply a way to add some arbitrary code in the middle of a chain of method invocations. You could use the Function to perform some complex logic to configure the builder, for instance.

        The return value of the function is ignored, but for safety and clarity, it should be a void return.

        Parameters:
        function - The Function to be invoked on this object.
        Returns:
        This ValueBuilder itself, for chaining convenience.

protected abstract ValueBuilder<T> maybeSet(@NotNull

                               boolean doSet)

        @NotNull
public ValueBuilder<T> maybeSet(@Nullable
                               T value,
                               boolean doSet)

      • get

        @Nullable
public abstract T get()
        Build the value (if needed) and return it. If a value was given (as with set(Object)), then it is simply returned. If a builder for a value was given (as with set(Builder)), then this method delegates to that's builder's Builder.get() method.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Builder<T>
        Specified by:
        get in interface com.google.common.base.Supplier<T>
        Returns:
        The built value.

      • always

        @NotNull
@Contract(value="-> !null")
public abstract ValueBuilder<T> always()
        Returns the top-level non-conditional builder.

      • maybe

        @NotNull
public abstract ValueBuilder<T> maybe(boolean yes)
        Returns a builder which either does or doesn't delegate to this builder based on the given boolean.
        Parameters:
        yes - If true, then methods invoked on the returned builder will modify the state of this builder. Otherwise, methods invoked on the returned builder will not modify state.

      • endMaybe

        @NotNull
public abstract ValueBuilder<T> endMaybe()
        Returns the parent builder of a conditional builder. This is not necessarily the originating top level builder if you have nested (or rather chained) calls to maybe(boolean).
